statement:
In any the self-dual *modular inequality* is true: if $ x\leq z $ then
$ x\lor (y\land z)\leq (x\lor y)\land z $.

$ x\leq x\lor y $ and we are given that $ x\leq z$, so
$ x\leq (x\lor y)\land z $. Also, $ y\land z\leq y \leq x\lor y $ and
$ y\land z\leq z $ imply that $ y\land z\leq (x\lor y)\land z$.
Therefore, $ x\lor (y\land z)\leq(x\lor y)\land z$.
